intro: Zygogynum megacarpum, commonly known as the giant African violet, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, which bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, warm environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant.
